body: Please carry and wear a face mask during a cherry blossom season. Yellow dust (황사) and ultra-fine dust (초미세먼지) are insane during the season and they cause pulmonary inflammation and are retained longe
summary: During cherry blossom season, it is advisable to carry and wear a face mask due to high levels of yellow dust and ultra-fine dust, which can cause pulmonary inflammation.

body: No it's not because of pollen. It is mostly because of pollution and desert sand blowing over from China/Mongolia during this time of the year.
summary: The dust during cherry blossom season in Korea is primarily due to pollution and desert sand from China/Mongolia, not pollen.

body: If you have a particular interest in history I'd say stay the night. It's probably doable as a day trip if you're highly organised, but if you're taking public transport, and spending time in the muse
summary: For those interested in history, an overnight stay is recommended to fully experience the destination and its museums, especially if using public transport.

body: What taksi pp should i use in Korea? Uber? How easy it is to get taxi using the app, and what is the general level of english spoken in Busan and Seoul?
summary: In Korea, taxis can be hailed via apps like Uber, but the level of English spoken by drivers in cities like Busan and Seoul may be limited.

body:
You can hail one from the street or take it from
The stand. Never had an issue with this. I find that English is not spoken much. I always had a hotel card with me indicating where I wanted to go.
summary: Hailing taxis from the street or stands is generally easy, and carrying a hotel card with the destination written in Korean can help overcome language barriers.
